lg.l: When first the Squire & Tinker, Wood,
Gravely consulting Irelands good
Together mingld in a Mass
Smiths-dust, with Copper, Lead & Brass,
The mixture thus by Chymick-art
United close in every part,
In Filets rolld, or cut in peices
Appeard like one continud Species,
And by the forming Engine Struck
On all, the same impression took!
So to confound this hated Coin
All parties & Religions join,
Whigs, Tories, Trimmers, Hannoverians,
Quakers, Conformists, Presbyterians,
Scotch, Irish, English, French Unite,
With equal Interest, equal Spite
Together mingld in a Lump
Do all in one Opinion jump
And every one begins to find
The same impression on his mind
A Strange Event! when Gold incites
To blood & quarrels, Brass unites
So Goldsmiths say the coarsest stuff
Will serve for Sodder well enough,
So by the Kettles loud alarm
The Bees are gatherd to a swarm
So by the TrumpetsBrazen Trumpets bluster
Troops of all tongues and Nations Muster
And to the Harp of Ireland brings

Whole crouds about its brazen StringsThere is a Chain let down from Jove,But fastend to his throne aboue,So Strong, that from the lower end,They say all humane things depend,This Chain (as ancient Poets hold)When Jove was young was made of GoldPrometheus once this Chain purloindDissolved, and into Money Coin'dThen Whips me on a Chain of Brass(Venus was bribd to let it pass)Now while this Brasen Chain prevaild,Jove saw that all devotion faild,No Temple to his Godship raisd,No Sacrifice on Altars blazd;In short such dire Confusion followdEarth must have bin in Chaos swallowdJove stood amazd but looking roundWith much adoe the Cheat he foundTwas plain he coud no longer holdThe World in any Chain but GoldAnd to the God of Wealth his BrotherSent Mercury to get anotherPrometheus on a Rock is laidTied with the Chain himself had madeOn Icy Caucasus to shiverWhilst Vultures eat his growing Liver
Ye Powers of Grubstreet make me able
Discreetly to apply this Fable!
Say who overis is to be understood
By that Old Theif Prometheus? Wood,
For Jove it tis not hard to guess him
I mean his M────y God bless him:
This Theif, & blacksmith, was so bold
He strove to steal that Chain of Gold
Which links hole Subject holeo the K──g
And change it for a brassen String:
But sure if nothing else must pass
Between the K──g and us but brass
Altho the Chain will never crack
Yet our Devotion may grow Slack:
But Jove will soon convert I hope
This brasen Chain into a Rope
With wch Prometheus shall be tied
And high in Air for ever ride
Where if we find his Liver grows
